questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a Microsoft 365 subscription that contains an Azure Virtual Desktop deployment. The Azure Virtual Desktop deployment contains a session host named Host1.

You install the Remote Desktop WebRTC Redirector Service and the Teams for virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) client on Host1.

You need to ensure that your webcam delivers the highest quality video for Teams calls.

How should you complete the registry key? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
As of February 11, 2025, MS-700 has removed "Plan and configure Teams for VDI" from its syllabus.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ms-700#change-log

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-desktop/teams-on-avd

Local machine and UseHardwareEncoding

Answer is correct. Refer to following site.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-desktop/teams-on-avd
"Enable hardware encode for Teams on Azure Virtual Desktop"
Local machine is correct one

Sensitive labels 
Access Review

Team1: A sensitivity label
Team2: An access review

Team1:
- a Lifecycle workflow
* Has nothing to do with guest users.
- A sensitivity label
* This will help enforce restrictions on who can add guests to Team1 and ensure that members cannot add guest accounts, as sensitivity labels can include policies to protect sensitive information.
- An access package
* an access package is not suitable for Team1 in this scenario because access packages are primarily used to manage access rights for a group of resources, including the ability to add or invite guest users. In the context of Team1, which requires preventing members from adding guest accounts, an access package would not fulfill that requirement effectively.
- Information barriers
* Not able to block guest accounts!

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/sensitivity-labels
I the first one answer is wrong. It should be -- Team1: A sensitivity label --

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a Microsoft 365 subscription that uses Teams and contains the teams shown in the following table.

//IMG//


You need to deploy an access solution that meets the following requirements:

• The members of Team1 must be prevented from adding guest accounts to the team.
• After every quarter, the owners of Team2 must review guest access and remove guests that no longer require access to the team.

What should you configure for each team? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E3 subscription.

You have a conference room that contains a Teams Rooms device named Device1. Device1 is assigned a Teams Rooms Basic license.

You need to ensure that you can restart Device1 from a remote location.

What should you do?

comments.content: The GUI behind "expiration policy" in AAD will trigger PowerShell. So you could do it by running "New-AzureADMSGroupLifecyclePolicy" or "Set-AzureADMSGroupLifecyclePolicy". Therefore "B" is correct, I guess.

You can set expiration policy only for Microsoft 365 groups in Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).

Microsoft 365 Admin center does not allow to change life cycle policy. So correct answer is B, PS command.

None is correct. To enable Groups Expiration policy, go to Azure Active Directory (AAD) > Groups > Expiration.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/admin/create-groups/office-365-groups-expiration-policy?view=o365-worldwide

choices.A: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, modify the teams policy.
choices.C: From the Microsoft 365 Compliance admin center, create a data loss prevention (DLP) policy.
choices.B: From PowerShell, run the New-AzureADMSGroupLifecyclePolicy cmdlet.
choices.D: From the Microsoft 365 admin center, modify the Office 365 group settings.

questions.question_text:
You are a Microsoft Teams administrator for your company.
All the teams used by the company's legal department must meet the following compliance requirements:
✑ Each team must expire 365 days after it is created.
✑ All team content must be deleted when the team expires.
✑ An administrator must be able to restore deleted team content for 30 days.
What should you do?

choices.A: a teams app setup policy in the Microsoft Teams admin center
choices.B: a sensitivity label in the Microsoft 365 Compliance admin center
choices.D: a teams policy in the Microsoft Teams admin center
choices.C: a supervision policy in the Microsoft 365 Compliance admin center
